articles.description: Jaren Jackson Jr. scored a career-high 27 points on 10-for-14 shooting for second-ranked Michigan State, and the Spartans cruised to their ninth consecutive victory by beating Minnesota 87-57 on Tuesday night.
articles.headline: No. 2 MSU tops Minnesota 87-57 with 27 points from Jackson

images.caption: Xavier Tillman gets the ball in the paint and finishes with a two-handed slam.
images.name: Tillman has one final throwdown

articles.description: Kyle Guy takes over in the second half and propels UVA to a 59-50 win over Miami.
articles.headline: Guy leads UVA to victory on the road

images.caption: Kyle Guy takes over in the second half and propels UVA to a 59-50 win over Miami.
images.name: Guy leads UVA to victory on the road

articles.description: Jared Samuelson set a North Dakota State record for number of treys made in a game, draining 9 of 13 to total a career-best 32 points and lead North Dakota State to an 87-53 thumping of NAIA member Mayville State on Tuesday night.
articles.headline: Samuelson drains 9 3s for new record, NDSU gets 87-53 win

articles.description: Alabama head coach Avery Johnson discusses his team's recent offensive explosion and getting it done on the defensive end.
articles.headline: Johnson, Crimson Tide believe in system

images.caption: Alabama head coach Avery Johnson discusses his team's recent offensive explosion and getting it done on the defensive end.
images.name: Johnson, Crimson Tide believe in system

articles.description: New No. 1 Virginia looked the part Tuesday, never trailing and holding Miami to 38 percent shooting to win 59-50.
articles.headline: New No. 1 Virginia beats Miami 59-50

images.caption: Kyle Guy takes over in the second half and propels UVA to a 59-50 win over Miami.
images.name: Guy leads UVA to victory on the road

articles.description: Donta Hall had 20 points and eight rebounds, including some powerful dunks, to lead Alabama to an 80-65 win over LSU on Tuesday night.
articles.headline: Donta Hall powers Alabama to 80-65 win over LSU

images.caption: Alabama head coach Avery Johnson discusses his team's recent offensive explosion and getting it done on the defensive end.
images.name: Johnson, Crimson Tide believe in system
